intro: Cienfuegosia ellenbeckii, commonly known as the Ellenbeck's cienfuegosia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
